etymologies: modern Latin, from Latin, literally ‘small stream’

definitions: a small tropical American fish of shallow fresh and brackish water. Often mistaken for a killifish or topminnow, the rivulus is distinguished by its tubular nostrils.

notes.text: Genus Rivulus, family Rivulidae: several species, many of which are spotted, in particular R. marmoratus

shortDefinitions: small tropical American killifish of fresh and brackish water
